text: CodeGear announces that their Next .Net product which is known as Delphi Prism Will be RemObjects's Oxygene.

Oxygene has many nice features that not found in Delphi or C#, and I think it will be a more effective solution for .Net than Delphi .Net previous releases, but it's uses Visual Studio IDE instead of Delphi IDE.
which has some cons and pros.
As Delphi Developer or .Net Developer, do you consider to use Delphi Prism for .Net developmenet?
Look at these Links for more info.
Delphi Prism - Visual Studio Pascal For .NET
